ARTICLE.TITLE: UAE-Israel deal a ‘historic step for peace’: Bahrain king tells Abu Dhabi crown prince
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Saudi Gazette report

MANAMA — Bahrain’s King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa has described the agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Israel as a "historic step for peace" in the region as it prevented Israel to annex more Palestinian territories, Bahrain News Agency reported on Friday.

He stressed that the deal will contribute to strengthening peace and stability in the Middle East in a way that serves the aspirations of its people for security, progress, and prosperity.

King Hamad made the remarks during a phone call he made to congratulate Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed on the landmark peace deal.

King Hamad commended the UAE’s honorable stances in defending the causes of the Arab and Islamic nations, principally the Palestinian cause.

Sheikh Mohammed expressed his gratitude to the Bahraini king for his support for the UAE’s efforts to bring peace and security in the region for the benefit of its states and people.

Both leaders also reviewed bilateral relations and ways to enhance cooperation in all areas.

They exchanged views on several topics and the latest regional and international developments of mutual interest.
